Stayed with a pet
review_text:
This home was very comfortable, clean, and cozy and nicely decorated. Everything was as described and the pictures depicting home were accurate. The neighborhood was quiet and we felt safe.
Things to note:
Bring your own Keurig kcups if you want coffee. The master bedroom mattress is very firm.
The home has electric air fresheners throughout the home leaving it overly fragranced. I am very sensitive to this and it aggravated my allergies/asthma. This of course is my personal health issue but people with allergies and or asthma should be aware. I have suggested that the owner cut back to one.
Aside from the fragrance issue, it was overall a great value, easy checkin/checkout, and I appreciate that the property allowed my small dog.

review_text: Overall great stay at the home. Itâ€™s right off the interstate which was great. We were traveling from NJ to FL which allowed us a place to rest our heads for the night. review_text: Tina's place was a great value for price. first Tina reached out way in advance to make contact about when we would arrive she had someone working to correct an issue at the house and wanted to make sure we weren't inconvenience in anyway. we were checking in super late so she had no issues with that. we were super quiet checking in around 1 am. neighborhood was very quiet and easy to relax and not worry about anything. Tina's place was super super clean and very decluttered . if I had anything that was a negative ..there were no small extras like other airbnbs have had in our past travels ( sugar ,creamer for coffee ) but we were only staying a few hours for sleep and on our way to finish our trip ..so didn't really need too many extras. mastered room had an amazing mattress. would totally stay in again

review_text:
This was our first Air B&B we have ever stayed at, and LOVED IT!
It was perfect. Nan & her husband did an amazing job at making us feel welcomed & comfortable.
The Room is cute. Has it's own entrance, bathroom & even a nice place outfront to sit and relax.
The bed is nice, comfy & cozy. The TV also had a fire stick which was perfect as we were winding down. Couldn't beat it.
The gardens at the house are beautiful & peaceful so make sure you spend some time outside.
We only needed 1 night as we were passing through, and it was PERFECT!
We stopped at a great brew house (Dirt Bags :) ) and also found an arcade/game center where you pay a cover & play air hockey, pool or a bunch of old school arcade style games. Even had a bar there.
Plenty of gas stations around to grab drinks & snacks.
Definitely worth staying there.
- Heather & Marc

review_text: Nan was an amazing host! She's very personable, the place is beautiful inside and outside with lovely art work that she's made and designed. Her gardens are phenomenal with lots of flowers feeding the pollinators, butterflies and flitting about joyfully. The bed is amazingly comfortable, it's a special foam type mattress. Everything was exceptionally clean with lots of extras. We had breakfast made by Nan and it was a delicious quiche, homemade zucchini break and melon that she grew. It's a fantastic, magical place surrounded by farm land, and not terribly far off 95, so it was the perfect stop for me and my elderly mom. Her husband, Kurt, was also very nice even if he is a Steelers fan (haha).

rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars

July 2020
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: From the ease of booking and prompt response to questions before arrival made me comfortable. When I arrived and saw the Art Teacher's artist sign I let ought a sigh and new I was in the right place. Plenty of parking and my private entrance was in the front of the home. My private patio was surrounded by lush gardening and water garden thing. When I opened the front door I was speechless. I could almost cry, the decor was so inviting, art work decorated the walls, fresh flowers from the garden on the table along with homemade zucchini bread. The furniture was even hand painted with beautiful floral designs. The antique furnishing and personal touches were so outstanding I was afraid to but my stuff on anything. The amenities were selected with the same personal attention to detail. There was plenty of everything, coffee, tea, water, snacks, reading materials, towels, toiletries, etc. Nan and her husband are so quite I almost forgot they were here. I will return just to relax. Nan's place is close enough to everything with just a few turns to a quite, lush green friendly neighborhood where we stay. I enjoyed riding my bike 6 miles through the neighborhood. And last but not least, the mattress made me feel like I was laying on a cloud, it was firm but not hard, soft but not sinking. As you see I cannot say enough about Nan's place. The price for all these GREATNESS is far below value. I would pay twice as much to stay here. I hope you read it all and stay at Nan's soon. Better hurry she stays booked up. I was blessed with a cancelation which enabled me to extend my stay. I enjoyed my week!!!

I also really enjoyed the private patio area at sunset where we could listen to the birds and enjoy the peace of a home in the country.

The breakfast service mentioned in the profile is well worth pursuing; ours were savory egg pastries with soft muffins and berries and were very tasty. The bed is large and comfortable, there is a TV with a number of streaming services and even internet access built in with a keyboard remote control, and a fridge, microwave and toaster oven. I have to give special praise to the bathroom as well; itâ€™s put together so well itâ€™s an atmospheric work of art with elegant furnishings, various shades of soothing blue and white, a very pleasant lavender smell, and a brewing station with coffee and tea stored in earthenware pots. Lastly the couple who owns this place are very friendly, helpful and accommodating.

review_text: Wonderful overnight stay in a secluded quiet setting. Very easy on/off of 95, plenty of parking, well lit surroundings, easy to enter even at night. Once inside it is a serene calming space with a small kitchenette area, with a fridge/freezer combo, coffee pot, toaster oven, large tv, comfortable queen bed, each bedside table had electric cord strips for charging etc. and a small dinette to work/eat at. The bathroom was very large and clean. There was an electric fireplace that produced a lovely warmth in the bathroom. Toiletries thoughtfully provided, plenty of towels and washcloths. I met Nan the next morning and she was such a gracious lovely lady. Would love to stay here again if Iâ€™m in the area!

Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text: To be honest I wish it was disclosed exactly what a work in progress this house is. It was dingy, sparsely furnished and had several areas in need of repair. The gate you enter to access the house is falling apart. The deck was saggy and uneven. The thresholds to all the rooms are uneven (not an issue for adults but with little kids is a major trip hazard). The bedrooms donâ€™t have bedside tables for placing any electronics on and the electric outlets are hidden behind the beds. We had to use an extension cord we happened to have with us to plug in a sound machine for our kids. There is a noticeable musty odor in the house. Luckily we were only there for a quick one night stop on our travels. If we had planned on being there longer we would have looked elsewhere after night one. We arrived after dark and it was hard to access the lockbox with no exterior lighting. There were no linens for the couch bed in the living room and a stain on the couch.

review_text:
I rented Williams home for one night on a long road trip with my Dad and younger siblings. William himself was very sweet and responsive. The place was clean for what it could be, it was just the smell of every room that was very unpleasant. It either smelt like feet, mildew or animals. I also woke up with a swollen hand from multiple mysterious bug bites.
Every home around had left their barking dogs outside, so trying to get a very needed good nights rest was out of the picture. Their outside patio was beautiful and the tub is huge but it has a sink faucet as the water spout so good luck for anyone trying to use it.
I feel terrible making a post like this but I was very uncomfortable. My sister has serious allergies and immediately couldn't breathe when we walked in. Nothing against William, he was a great host. It was just the house itself. You can tell they did their best to keep it as clean as they could but it was not worth the price we paid.

review_text:
Overall, this was a great budget stay, and I WOULD RECOMMEND. 5 star host, 3-4 star house and location, and not because of a bad experience, but just because that's what this area is. The house was exactly as described, and the host was friendly and helpful. Here are the details:
Property: The back fence has some holes in it that open to the neighbors, and while the host has them blocked off, we didn't feel comfortable letting our dogs out unsupervised or without harnesses. The house is very clean! The beds were comfortable, and it seemed to have everything needed. You won't be wowed, but you'll be taken care of.
Location: The neighborhood isn't the best ever, but it's also very standard for this area of North Carolina, so that's hard to rate fairly.
Noise Levels: We stayed on Christmas Eve. Turns out Christmas Eve is a firework and gun shooting holiday, so it was noisy all night. There are a few neighboring dogs that bark pretty consistently as well.

review_text: Loved staying at Williams' place. it was cozy and comfortable and was made to feel very welcomed. it's always very difficult when you have dogs with you that you've trained to be respectable when in a new environment and so they are very well behaved and when trying to break the stigma other pet parents have placed on hosts is challenging. especially when those other pet parents don't follow the same principles as we have with our dogs. review_text: I chose Williams place because I make frequent trips to NC and wanted to stay somewhere other than the local hotels. The house was located about 10 mins away from family and in the vacinity of various restaurants/stores. The neighborhod has more of a city feel as opposed to a country one but it was extremely quiet and felt very safe. The house is old, but that fact is stated clearly in the description and it felt very much like home. The pictures are accurate, William provided an ample amount of supplies (cleaning, toiletries, linens, towels), and the place was clean. The beds were extremely comfy and it was easy to find something entertaining to watch on television. I was a fan of the master bathroom because not only was it huge, it contained the infamous jacuzzi tub which is quite relaxing as long as you dont run the water too hot. William was also very responsive to all the questions and concerns that we had during our stay. Overall, we enjoyed ourselves and would recommend it.

review_text:
First let me say that Iâ€™m originally from Lumberton and was really surprised to see an Airbnb in the area but especially one this nice. Iâ€™ve never stayed in a mobile home before and trust me it looks nothing like the outside or the surroundings.
Itâ€™s located across the street from a discount warehouse and right off the highway. It was raining when we arrived and the host was kind enough to not only inquire if we made it in town safely but also remotely unlocked the door so we didnâ€™t have to fumble with the remote lock. I would definitely recommend downloading the August app for easy keyless access to this space.
The accommodations were just as pictured, smelled nice and it was very clean. It was moderately/very well appointed with updated appliances, full cookware and baking set, flatware and dishes. A Keurig (with the latte and cappuccino maker), creamer, sugar and various k-cup pods were also available. I wished there was a measuring spoon/cup set because I actually did cook.
There was a grill on the back patio with furniture but we didnâ€™t use it due to the rain. Speaking of, please note that there is no paved parking, just grass (or mud if itâ€™s raining). Also the main bedroom is on the side closest to the main road so if you are a light sleeper you may be very aware of cars driving by at night. I would definitely stay here again.

I see why Jaywan is super host and this little hideaway is super comfy and cozy!
Thanks to the Nest air system and nice mattresses we all slept comfortably at night and were perfectly warm/cool during the day. Found everything we needed in the kitchen and baths. The oversized state of the art washer and dryer were also a treat when my son spilled salad dressing on his only jacket.
Jaywan was the perfect host. He Splurged on multiple (4) TVs and all the premium TV channels. My kids and dad were in heaven. Actually so was I. Most ABNBs only have 2 TVs and only a few channel choices. During our down time, having all of these viewing options plus the Wi-Fi is a real luxury. We were really pleasantly surprised. My kids are usually constantly negotiating for the tv during the entire vaca, here it is not an issue. THANKS ğŸ™ğŸ½!!! Jaywan said He wanted his guests to be just as comfortable away from home as he is when heâ€™s at home. So he provides Disney Plus, HBO Max, Starz , Cinemax, Hulu Peacock. Prime. Â·

review_text: Arleen's place was a choice almost last-minute find on our road trip from Florida to Virginia after Thanksgiving. We weren't sure until just a few days before where our road trip route would go or where we'd want to stop. Once we figured that out, a search for hotel lodging turned up few options. Arleen's offer on AirBNB was more than competitive with area hotels, and no downtown hotel can provide what Arleen has built here - a true home away from home, sparkling clean, with a full kitchen and a full-sized fridge (very important for hauling home all those extra leftovers!) , and plenty of space to relax and unwind in a quiet area not far from the highway. She also provides very comfortable sleeping arrangements, and thoughtful extras like light snacks and keurig pods to get you fueled up for your mornings. Arleen was very responsive to questions, We would definitely stay here again next year, without a second thought!

Incredibly quick communication: After a check-engine light came on Sunday night, I sent a message to Arleen asking if they knew much about cars. Within two minutes Mark called to say he would call their mechanic in the morning. He did and got me the information I needed! Like so many other reviews, I wholeheartedly recommend this Airbnb.

name: Dominique
rating_info:
Rating, 1 star
,

,
Â·
Group trip
review_text:
The price was not worth the stay. I booked and paid for two nights but stayed only one night. As an air b n b host myself I was dissatisfied with the experience and the advertisement.
This is a modular home, sited within a trailer park community. The unit had one half roll of toilet paper and 4 sets of towels ONLY. Guests that are visiting and not staying overnight are welcomed in the advertisement, but in response to a question about the lack of toilet tissue I was told there was additional
Tissue in the master closet when there was NOT (I had to buy); in fact despite the advertisement welcoming visitors the immediate response was that I would need modify my reservation to include additional guests , because the cleaner counted 7 people versus 5. The unit was not available at 3pm as advertised. It was not ready at 4pm as discussed. The cleaning person was in the unit 20-30 minutes after check-in. The bathroom doors do not lock properly. There was a brown stain on the bedding. Under the beds were not cleaned ( white particles). The internet/WiFi worked about 25% of the time. Since there is only streaming services available on the TV that meant incessant buffering. Despite these many issues with the stay and the modular unit, the host had very stringent rules about smoking, returning the place to its exact (implied pristine) condition, and shoes in the house; me and my guest respected all of the rules of the home.
I definitely would not recommend staying here unless the price was significantly reduced and the host was explicitly honest about the unit, itâ€™s amenities, and the condition of the modular home.

review_text: Reta's place was incredible! It is in a beautiful setting, right out of a movie. Reta's family owns a tree farm and the walking paths surrounding it are amazing! However, the sleeping arrangements do need to be discussed. I was lucky as there was only me and my dog (with her pillow). I am not sure how two people or folks with limited mobility would have been able to sleep on the "chair beds". Yes, the pictures on the posting make it look easy to change the chairs into beds. There is also a set of directions on a sheet of household informational tidbits like wifi, etc.. However, I was unsuccessful and used one of the mattresses I found. After driving all day and two Tylenol PM, I was ready to sleep anywhere. I am not sharing this info to keep anyone from staying here. I just think a more realistic description of the sleeping arrangements needs to be shared.

name: V
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
November 2022
,
Â·
Stayed one night
review_text: Our group of three had to cancel our booking at another location and needed to find a place to stay at the last minute. By luck this tiny house had just been listed and even though it had no reviews (at the time) we contacted the host to see if it would be right for our needs and after a quick exchange we went ahead and booked it for two different stays. We were a bit nervous at the idea of being one of the first guests to stay at this location, but we had absolutely nothing to worry about. The property is just a few short minutes off I-95 surrounded by trees and away from all the noise. A code is needed to check in which our hosts sent to us before we arrived and we were able to park directly next to the house itself. A note was waiting for us with a contact number that we actually had to use because we couldn't figure out how to work the tv (which is set up with Roku and Netflix). Not only were the hosts more than happy to help resolve the issue but they wasted no time to get it fixed; when we walked through the door on our second stay the tv was set up and ready to go! There are three sleeper chairs with linens, but an air mattress is offered as a substitute for one of the chairs and a queen sized bed in a separate area can also be used at no extra charge which really goes to show how much the hosts care about the comfort of their guests. There's a kitchenette sink, mini fridge, and stove combo as well as a small microwave and two coffee machines (k-cup and standard). The kitchen provides cups, cutlery, plates, a few cooking utensils, and a convertible table that seats two. The bathroom is roomy, has plenty of towels, and the walk-in shower has consistent hot water with good pressure. What we really appreciated were the small touches such as the snacks/candy on the kitchen table, the waters and sodas stocked in the fridge, the board game in the main area, and the fire wood for the outside pit; on our second stay there were sugars and creamers available as well as body wash and shampoo/conditioner in addition to everything else. However, nothing will highlight how kind and generous these hosts are more than the message we got from them between our stays asking after our well being as they knew we were in Florida at the time Nicole was passing through the state. It was an absolute joy to stay at the tiny house with these hosts and we highly recommend others to stay here whether it's for one night or an extended stay.

There was no smell, no noise, and it felt safe and was clean and sooooo comfy--including the furniture. It was really spacious, and there were so many nice touches: loved the lighting, Netflix seasons I haven't seen of my fav shows, fresh sage and rosemary in the planters, the cabinet of creamers, coffee, cocoa, and oatmeal, nice coffee maker, perfect firm bed (and the other one not so much for those who don't want firm), beautiful quilts, luxury sheets, covers, pillows... easy in and out, super easy quick digital lock. It was truly perfect. Even a welcome biscuit for Willow! And the place is just adorable, so artistic. What an incredibly professional thoughtful host!!
